alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 10:09PM EDT until October 02 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Connecticut... Farmington River At Unionville affecting Hartford County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Connecticut... Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Farmington River at Simsbury. * WHEN...From late tonight to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins with numerous roads and residences affected. Evacuations may be needed along various roads in Avon and Simsbury, including Riverside Road in Simsbury. Flooding also begins to affect low lying sections of Bloomfield and East Granby. Follow the directions of emergency management officials and obey all road closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:31 PM EDT Friday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 14.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.2 feet on 09/09/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 615 AM EDT.
